text: ਭੈਰਉ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤਾ ਕੀ ॥ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀਉ ਘਰੁ ੧
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Bhairao, The Word Of The Devotees, Kabeer Jee, First House:

transliteration.text: bhairau bānī bhagatā kī . kabīr jīu ghar 1

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਇਹੁ ਧਨੁ ਮੇਰੇ ਹਰਿ ਕੋ ਨਾਉ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Name of the Lord - this alone is my wealth.

transliteration.text: ih dhan mērē har kō nāu .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਗਾਂਠਿ ਨ ਬਾਧਉ ਬੇਚਿ ਨ ਖਾਉ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I do not tie it up to hide it, nor do I sell it to make my living. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: gānhth n bādhau bēch n khāu .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

text: ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਖੇਤੀ ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਬਾਰੀ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Name is my crop, and the Name is my field.

transliteration.text: nāu mērē khētī nāu mērē bārī .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As Your humble servant, I perform devotional worship to You; I seek Your Sanctuary. ||1||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. text: ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਮਾਇਆ ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਪੂੰਜੀ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Name is Maya and wealth for me; the Name is my capital.

transliteration.text: nāu mērē māiā nāu mērē pūnjī .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I do not forsake You; I do not know any other at all. ||2||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. text: ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਬੰਧਿਪ ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਭਾਈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Name is my family, the Name is my brother.

transliteration.text: nāu mērē bandhip nāu mērē bhāī .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. text: ਨਾਉ ਮੇਰੇ ਸੰਗਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਹੋਇ ਸਖਾਈ ॥੩॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Name is my companion, who will help me in the end. ||3||

transliteration.text: nāu mērē sang ant hōi sakhāī .3.

text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਹਉ ਤਾ ਕੋ ਦਾਸੁ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: - says Kabeer, I am his slave. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr hau tā kō dās .4.1.
